text: The Olmedilla Photovoltaic Park in Olmedilla de Alarcón, Spain, is the world’s largest photovoltaic plant. Built in 2008, the plant uses more than 160,000 solar photovoltaic panels to generate 60 megawatts (peak).Al Gore (2009). Our Choice, p. 65. It produces enough electricity to power more than 40,000 homes. ==Related pages== *Photovoltaics ==References== Category:Solar power plants Category:Buildings and structures in Spain Category:2008 establishments in Europe Category:2000s establishments in Spain
title: Olmedilla Photovoltaic Park
